group_1.textRight: Eh, out of firewood.

group_1.textLeft: I can go get some.

group_1.textRight: Can you go by yourself? @Momma's hands are full at the moment.

group_1.textLeft: I'd really like to go with you...
But, I can do it.

group_1.textRight: Ha ha ha.
Youâ€™re always so energetic Chika.
Do you do this all the time?

group_1.textLeft: Not all the time, only about four times a month.

group_1.textRight: Almost every week then! That's how you keep @yourself in shape.

group_1.textLeft: What about you? You're starting to put on some @weight!
Then, let's go get the firewood together gramps!
It can start your new routine!
Go for it. Go on.

group_1.textRight: Eh.

group_1.textLeft: Here dad.
I grabbed as many different sizes of logs as I could.

group_1.textRight: Oh, that's pretty smart, but I mainly wanted the little ones.

group_1.textLeft: Well we can take the big ones home for the fireplace then.

group_1.textRight: Good idea.
Fireplace?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, our house has a fireplace.

group_1.textRight: Oh, was it built recently? It has a very foreign style.

group_1.textLeft: My parents didn't have a hearth in the house where @I grew up.
I always wanted one growing up.

group_1.textRight: Then your dream came true here in Kamihama.

group_1.textLeft: I thought you two were old friends?

group_1.textRight: We were just neighbors who were close in age.

group_1.textLeft: Heh~!

group_1.textRight: I never thought we would be working together in Kamihama.
No, living in that little village on the edge of the mountains, this was inevitable.

group_1.textLeft: That was a pretty nice place to live.
The village where my dad grew up. I'm curious about it...

group_1.textRight: That's right.
Say Chika, did you ever hear the story of how your mother and father met?

group_1.textLeft: Oh!

group_1.textRight: [chara:800600:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Hey, Chika!
Don't you have a lot of homework that you need to @be doing?!
Why don't you go finish it before dinner?

group_1.textLeft: Fine...

group_1.textRight: If I remember correctly, Chika goes to St. Liliana Academy right?

group_1.textLeft: Yes!
...But I only got in there from a recommendation.
I wrote an essay on the environment and passed an interview.

group_1.textRight: That's still impressive.
But, you're going to have to keep studying hard.
And so I will hold off on the story until you finish @your homework!

group_1.textLeft: I'll do my best!

group_1.textRight: Eh, hold on!
Hey after dinner can I talk to you for a bit?
Just the two of us.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, yeah that's fine.
